instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 no green light ppbus_g3h=8.18v
threads.message:
Board is very neat ppbus_g3h=8.18v
pp5v_s5=5.1v
Pp3v3_s5= pulsing
PP5v_s4rs3=0v
All_sys_pwrgd=0v
PCH SIGNALS
PPVRTC_G3H=3.3v
PCH_INTVRMEN=3.3V
PM_BATLOW_L=0v
PM_DSW_PWRGD=0v
SMC_ADAPTER_EN=0v

threads.title: 820-00165 no green light ppbus_g3h=8.18v
threads.message:
"SMC_WAKE_L=0V"
Check R5002; force it with 100K instead of 1M, if needed.

threads.title: 820-00165 no green light ppbus_g3h=8.18v
threads.message: What do you mean by force with 100k

threads.title: 820-00165 no green light ppbus_g3h=8.18v
threads.message:
In case it has correct 1M, like in schematic.
But still 0V on that signal...

threads.title: 820-00165 no green light ppbus_g3h=8.18v
threads.message: I have replaced R5002 is a 100k resistor...no changes
